paper_abstract: The energy E of any n-vertex regular graph G of degree r, r > 0, is greater than or equal to n. Equality holds if and only if every component of G is isomorphic to the complete bipartite graph Kr,r. If G is triangle- and quadrangle-free, then E >= nr/root 2-r-1. In particular, for any fullerene and nanotube with n carbon atoms, 1.34n <= E <= 1.73n.
paper_title: On the energy of regular graphs
